definition: affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request

sentences.english: Do come up and see me some time.
sentences.chinese: 務請某個時候上來看看我。

sentences.english: Please make sure you understand this point.
You must read the conditions and instructions attached to this Application Form.
sentences.chinese: 務請細閱本申請表格所附載之條件及指示。

sentences.english: Maybe a more polite way is “at your earliest convenience.
sentences.chinese: 或許更客氣的說法是“在您方便時，務請從速回復”。

sentences.english: Please see to it that the goods sent are what we need.
sentences.chinese: 務請確信所發貨物時我們所需要的。

sentences.english: Links exchange application, the Treasury, please use the following code links to this site.
sentences.chinese: 申請鏈接交換，務請先使用下面的代碼做好本站鏈接。
務請告訴我發生了什麼。

sentences.english: Do join me for a coffee.
sentences.chinese: 務請同我一起喝杯咖啡。

sentences.english: Do stay for a couple more days.
Please do exactly as your doctor says.
sentences.chinese: 務請按照醫生的吩咐行事。

sentences.english: Some necklaces can't plate a film and maintain because of the craft problem, please wear carefully.
sentences.chinese: 某些項鍊因工藝問題不能鍍膜和維修，務請小心佩戴。

definition: to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
lit. to attend to one thing and lose sight of another (idiom)/fig. to be unable to manage two or more things at once/cannot pay attention to one thing without neglecting the other
wording/way of expressing something/turn of phrase/diction
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
